questions.question_text: Which of the following formula is used to calculate the EPS of the organization?

discussion.content: B. EPS = number of normalized events / time in seconds

la risposta e C 
Event Per Second (EPS) The number of events coming into the system is known as Events Per Second (EPS). The SIEM sizing depends upon how fast a security device generates events and how fast a SIEM product can correlate events from those devices. This ratio is referred to as SIEM velocity. It is measured in terms of Events Per Second (EPS). EPS = Number of security events/Time in seconds EPS helps organizations to correlate the capacity of IT infrastructure and plan and choose the best suited SIEM solution for them

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C. EPS = number of security events / time in seconds

Correction to my answer: It is C. Number of Security Events/Time in Seconds. My bad.
